intro: Aidia auriculata var. auriculata, commonly known as the auriculate aidia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical name reflects the auriculate (ear-shaped) base of its leaves. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
